Body:
Description: Hi there,

Just a quick question, if you don't mind?

My team and I have noticed an account called 'NoUser' within Device Control -> Users that appears to be checking in every minute, across all devices within the company, such that if you search for that user and refresh the search, the "last computer" field changes every time.

Is this normal?

If so, is there any available explanation as to what this noUser account is? Can we remove it without causing any impact? I notice that it has the groups set as "Allow All" which is the only example of this within the company.

Many Thanks,
Conor
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Emil Podar, Conor Lane
What We've Learned Updated: The customer reported that for some computers the EPP Client is reporting "NoUser" for the logged user.

Next Steps Updated: The customer collected a set of logs and I attached them to the ADO.
Waiting for an update from R&D.

What We've Learned Updated: The customer reported that for some computers the EPP Client is reporting "NoUser" for the logged user.

R&D concluded that this is an expected behavior, and advised to upgrade the server and clients to the latest versions that include improved noUser logging.

What We've Learned Updated: The customer reported that for some computers the EPP Client is reporting "NoUser" for the logged user.

R&D concluded that this is an expected behavior, and advised to upgrade the server and clients to the latest versions that include improved noUser logging.

We informed the customer about the R&D findings.

Next Steps Updated: The customer collected a set of logs and I attached them to the ADO.
Waiting for an update from R&D.

Waiting for the customer's feedback.
